comment: Best History professor - if you do not take him, you will regret it. Class is structured so there is 0 work required. Tests are open-note and open-book (he brings the books). Quizzes are the same except you are also allowed electronics. Slides are underlined with the info that you will need to know. Only thing is that attendance is 11 points.

very easy A yet some people struggled sooo much cause they would not come to class or have notes for open note tests. Only bad thing is attendance.. each class counts 1 point out off 11 so if you miss 11 classes the highest grade u can make is B. Also he never replies to emails; i emailed him 5+ times and never once received a reply over the sem

Professor Pierce will give you an opportunity to learn if you are interested. Quizzes are take home and Tests and  are open-note and open-internet, except for the first test. Attendance is calculated as 11 percent of the final grade, so try to show up most of the time. I made hundreds on  everything  with minimal effort outside of class. Take him.

Literally the nicest man I've ever met. Show up to class, sign in and you can leave. He lectures heavy but you don't have to listen. He truly enjoys his job. All of test were open book open note/electronic use except for first exam! I hate history but he literally tells you where the answers are on exam. They are labels by chapters! Take him!

Fantastic professor. Every test and all but one quiz are open note. If you don't get an "A" reconsider college. I feel like a lot of people take advantage of how easy the class is and skip. But I encourage you to go to lectures and listen to what he has to say.  He's a great person and has so much knowledge in history to share.

He is nice and passionate about history. Attendance is mandatory. He lets students take notes on laptops and we can use the notes on the tests and quizzes. The tests and quizzes are essay format and you have to write a lot of information down, but like I said, you can just use your notes and copy it word for word. Just show up and you get an A.

This class was awesome because Proffesor pierce just wants you to pass. 6 quizzes and 3 exams, after the first exam, everything was open book, open note, open computer, including the final and the PowerPoint that he lectures from is right on d2l. You'd have to try Not to pass this class. Definitely would take him again.
rating_tags: Caring--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Clear grading criteria

comment: This man is not only a very knowledgeable professor, but he also cares about and is passionate about the material he covers. I would highly recommend him to anyone. You have to show up to class, but all of the tests/quizzes are open note/open internet. I respect the hell out of this man! If you read these Dr. Pierce, thank you, you saved my GPA.

This class was pretty straight forward, the first test he assigns is not open book/ open note. Everything else is, the grades consist of quizzes, written assignments, & exams, they are all really easy & shouldn't give anyone too much trouble. Make sure you show up for class, he gives points at the end of the semester for attendance.

He is a really nice professor who lets you use your notes on most of the tests. This  class is really easy, and I highly recommend taking it. Attendance is mandatory. Every day you are not in class, you get one point deducted off of your final grade.

Lectures are long and can be boring (power points with blocks of text), but Pierce loves talking about history. He underlines everything that will be on a quiz or test, so you don't even have to attend lectures. Quizzes and tests are also open note/open internet. Also, you never use the textbook.

Best history teacher. Open note open book open internet tests. He loves his history. He has a passion for history. Very educated in history. He is willing to help. Do his easy online assignments and read over his powerpoints and you will get an A for sure.

He wants his students to succeed. He lets his students use open booknotes on quizzes and tests. If you have questions about anything, he's just an email away. Show up to class and you're guaranteed to pass.
Show up for class cause it counts towards your grade. Have your notes and power points ready. Take him and you'll do well.
As long you show up for class and have a laptop for notespowerpoints you will easily get an A+.

Everything is open notes! I brought my computer and opened up the powerpoints during the test. He is also so sweet and is there to talk to you about anything you need. I did not use the book at all just looked over his powerpoints. He also has interesting stories and loves to teach! Best teacher hands down <3
Tests are quizzes are all open note! Just come to the class and you'll get an A!!! Take him!!!
He is very informative and very helpful. You will easily get an "A" by coming to class and study the powerpoint presentations. Quizzes and tests are very easy!
